verses.kjv: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
verses.ct: But you must teach what aligns with healthy teaching.

verses.kjv: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
verses.ct: Older men should be clear-headed, dignified, self-controlled, and solid in their faith, love, and endurance.

verses.kjv: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
verses.ct: In the same way, older women should live in a way that reflects holiness. They shouldn't be gossips or heavy drinkers, but instead should teach what is good.

verses.kjv: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
verses.ct: That way they can train the younger women to be level-headed, to love their husbands, and to love their children,

verses.kjv: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
verses.ct: to be sensible, pure, devoted to their homes, kind, and respectful toward their own husbands, so that no one will speak against God's message.

verses.kjv: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.
verses.ct: Similarly, encourage the young men to be self-controlled.

verses.kjv: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
verses.ct: In everything, set an example through your own good actions. In your teaching, show integrity, seriousness, and genuineness.

verses.kjv: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
verses.ct: Use healthy words that no one can criticize, so that anyone who opposes you will be put to shame because they have nothing bad to say about you.

verses.kjv: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;
verses.ct: Tell servants to submit to their own masters and to satisfy them in every way, without talking back.

verses.kjv: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
verses.ct: They shouldn't steal from them but should demonstrate complete trustworthiness, so that in everything they do, they make the teaching about God our Savior attractive.

verses.kjv: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
verses.ct: For God's grace has now appeared, offering salvation to all people.

verses.kjv: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
verses.ct: It trains us to reject ungodliness and worldly desires, and instead to live with self-control, righteousness, and devotion to God in this present age,

verses.kjv: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
verses.ct: while we wait for the wonderful hope we look forward to â€” the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
verses.ct: He gave himself for us to rescue us from every kind of sin and to cleanse for himself a people who are uniquely his own, passionate about doing good.

verses.kjv: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
verses.ct: Teach these things, encourage people, and correct them with full authority. Don't let anyone look down on you.
